Block.Instructions:
Put your middle or index fingers on the E and I keys of your keyboard. Words or images representing the categories at the top will appear one-by-one in the middle of the screen. When the item belongs to a category on the left, press the E key; when the item belongs to a category on the right, press the I key. Items belong to only one category. If you make an error, an X will appear - fix the error by hitting the other key.

This is a timed sorting task. GO AS FAST AS YOU CAN while making as few mistakes as possible. Going too slow or making too many errors will result in an uninterpretable score. This task will take about 5 minutes to complete.

Press the space bar to begin.
Block.TInstructions:
Touchable areas are blinking, tap the left area for a left response and the right area for a right response. Words or images representing the categories at the top will appear one-by-one in the middle of the screen. When the item belongs to a category on the left, tap the left (red) area; when the item belongs to a category on the right, tap the right (blue) area. Items belong to only one category. If you make an error, an X will appear - fix the error by tapping the other area.

This is a timed sorting task. GO AS FAST AS YOU CAN while making as few mistakes as possible. Going too slow or making too many errors will result in an uninterpretable score. This task will take about 5 minutes to complete.

Block.Instructions:

Block.TInstructions:
See above, the categories have changed. The items for sorting have changed as well. The rules, however, are the same.


When the items belongs to a category on the left, tap the left area; when the item belongs to a category on the right, tap the right area. Items belong to only one category. An X appears after an error - fix the error by tapping the other area. GO AS FAST AS YOU CAN.

Block.Instructions:
See above, the four categories you saw separately now appear together. Remember, each item belongs to only one group. For example, if the categories flower and good appeared on separate sides above - pictures or words meaning flower would go in the flower category, not the good category.


The green and white labels and items may help to identify the appropriate category. Use the E and I keys to categorize items into the four groups left and right, and correct errors by hitting the other key.


Press the space bar to begin
Block.TInstructions:
See above, the four categories you saw separately now appear together. Remember, each item belongs to only one group. For example, if the categories flower and good appeared on separate sides above - pictures or words meaning flower would go in the flower category, not the good category.


The green and white labels and items may help to identify the appropriate category. Tap the right and the left areas to categorize items into the four groups left and right, and correct errors by tapping the other area.

Block.Instructions:
Notice above, there are only two categories and they have switched positions. The concept that was previously on the left is now on the right, and the concept that was on the right is now on the left. Practice this new configuration.


Use the E and I keys to categorize items left and right, and correct errors by hitting the other key.
